meanings.definition: Able to be predicted or estimated in advance.
meanings.sent1: The weather forecastable predicted rain for tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: It is important to have forecastable data for planning purposes.
meanings.sent3: The forecastable outcome of the experiment made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her mood swings were as forecastable as the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's test questions were so forecastable that everyone aced the exam.

meanings.definition: Capable of being forecasted or foretold.
meanings.sent1: The stock market is not always forecastable due to its volatility.
meanings.sent2: The economist's predictions were surprisingly forecastable this time.
meanings.sent3: The forecastable nature of the fortune teller's predictions amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: His success was as forecastable as the sunrise each morning.
meanings.sent5: The old sailor's tales were filled with forecastable events that came true.
